1565330250_18h7dSc5vXQNRA1sjyUmX7zaUTsFA.body:
> [nickwa](#comment_271_1EFZ3dYDWVpD4kF5H9PF83HjPAehEEKKJj): Have you tried deleting the site then re-downloading it? Sounds cliche, but might work. Some sites I used to have issues like that, I just re-downloaded and it fixed the issue.

Deleted and redownloaded as per your suggestion. Stuck @2748 this time.

I wonder if the peer count could be an attack where if a botnet shows up with 9000 peers, and your computer connects to 200 of them, then chances are that all 200 connections are the botnet. Then the botnet simply doesn't send you new updates.

> [trevorlaneray](#comment_3_12eXcQ1ojAbyCoCcMQ3JAKi73wgcJrjow3): While I have little to no experience with ZeroNet, this sounds strangely plausible. Yikes.

It's good in a way if true. Your enemy fighting you isn't the worst thing. The worst thing is being so insignificant that he doesn't even deign to notice you. You only take flack over a target.
